name: The Sound of Thunder
description: As part of my Masters Thesis Project for MSc in Sound and Music Computing at Queen Mary University of London, I'm running a questionnaire for the realism of different thunder audio files.  In this survey, you'll be asked to rate various audio clips based on their realism, using a scale from 1 to 5, where 1 means "least realistic" and 5 means "most realistic."

questionControl.question: How old are you ?
How would you describe your knowledge of audio quality ?
options: Professional working in the area of audio
Audio enthusiast but I don't work in the area
I don't normally pay attention to audio quality
questionControl.value: ["I don't normally pay attention to audio quality"]

questionControl.question: How would you describe your hearing ?
options: Hearing deficiency in one or both ears

questionControl.question: What Listening environment are you in right now ?
What are you using to listen to these audio clips ?
options: Studio headphones (e.g. Audio Technica or other)

name: The Sound of Thunder
description: As part of my Masters Thesis Project for MSc in Sound and Music Computing at Queen Mary University of London, I'm running a questionnaire for the realism of different thunder audio files.  In this survey, you'll be asked to rate various audio clips based on their realism, using a scale from 1 to 5, where 1 means "least realistic" and 5 means "most realistic."

questionControl.question: How old are you ?
How would you describe your knowledge of audio quality ?
options: Professional working in the area of audio
Audio enthusiast but I don't work in the area
I don't normally pay attention to audio quality
questionControl.value: ["Audio enthusiast but I don't work in the area"]

questionControl.question: How would you describe your hearing ?
options: Hearing deficiency in one or both ears

questionControl.question: What Listening environment are you in right now ?
What are you using to listen to these audio clips ?
options: Studio headphones (e.g. Audio Technica or other)

items.title: How realistic does this audio clip 5 sound?

fields.question: Please listen to the audio clip provided below and rate how close to real thunder the audio clip sounds on a scale from 1 to 5, with 5 being the most realistic and 1 being the least realistic.

questionControl.question: Please explain your reasoning behind your rating.
questionControl.value: Depending on the rationale this is excellent or just good. If it's simulating a phone microphone for example picking up thunder from far away then it is a really good recreation especially with the blips that overload it in the beginning, if it's meant to be as if heard by human ear then those blips make it sound less realistic. The rumbles are good though.
